prompt: Die Glocke oben rechts ist nicht verfügbar, auch nicht wenn die Erweiterung "Alert Notification" installiert ist.
expected_answer: Stellen Sie sicher, dass Benachrichtigungen in Ihrem Wiki aktiviert sind. Sie können sie aktivieren, indem Sie die Einstellung `notifications.enabled` in `xwiki.properties` auf `true` setzen.

Wenn die Glocke für Benachrichtigungen in XWiki nicht angezeigt wird, obwohl die Erweiterung "Alert Notification" installiert ist, könnte es mehrere Gründe dafür geben. Hier sind einige Schritte zur Fehlerbehebung:

1. **Überprüfen der Installation**: Stellen Sie sicher, dass die "Notifications Application" korrekt installiert und aktiviert ist. Es könnte hilfreich sein, die Erweiterung erneut zu installieren oder zu aktualisieren.

2. **Benutzerrechte prüfen**: Vergewissern Sie sich, dass Sie die erforderlichen Berechtigungen haben, um Benachrichtigungen zu sehen. Möglicherweise sind die Benachrichtigungseinstellungen so konfiguriert, dass sie nur bestimmten Benutzerrollen zur Verfügung stehen.

3. **Benachrichtigungseinstellungen überprüfen**: Navigieren Sie zu Ihren Benachrichtigungseinstellungen und prüfen Sie, ob die Benachrichtigungen aktiviert sind. Dies kann über Ihr Benutzerprofil oder die Administrationsseite erfolgen.

4. **Administrator kontaktieren**: Falls Sie keine administrativen Rechte haben, könnte es sinnvoll sein, sich mit dem XWiki-Administrator in Verbindung zu setzen, um zu klären, ob die Benachrichtigungen zentral deaktiviert wurden.

5. **Log-Dateien prüfen**: Überprüfen Sie die Log-Dateien von XWiki auf Fehlermeldungen, die auf ein Problem mit der Benachrichtigungsanwendung hinweisen könnten.

Falls diese Schritte nicht zur Lösung des Problems führen, könnte es sich um ein spezifisches technisches Problem handeln, das von einem Entwickler oder einem technischen Support-Team weiter untersucht werden sollte.

### Watch and custom filters

Watching a location automatically create a custom notification filter, associated to that location, that targets all event types and all notification formats (alert and email).

XWiki 15.5+ Users are able to create their own custom notification filters, targeting only some specific events. So the watch buttons might be in an undecided state if there's an existing filter targeting the same location, but only some specific events, or some specific format. The idea is to inform the user that there's already a filter for this location and that using the watch buttons might impact the filter. 

If a filter is not targeting all event types and all formats, and is actually in contradiction with the filter that would be created by the watch button, then this filter will be automatically disabled when using the watch button. For example, if a user had a filter to ignore all mentions on a space, then watching that exact same space will automatically disable that filter. The user can always review their filters and enable them back.

![notification-watch-undecided.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notification-watch-undecided.png?rev=1.1)



XWiki 16.3.0+ The custom filters are all displayed in a live data which can now be filtered and sorted out: 

![notification-custom-filters-livedata.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notification-custom-filters-livedata.png?rev=1.1)  
![notification-custom-filters-livedata-filters.webm](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notification-custom-filters-livedata-filters.webm?rev=1.1)

There are several ways you can be notified in XWiki:

* [Notifications Application](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Notifications#HNotificationsApplication)
* [Share Page by mail](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Notifications#HSharePagebymail)
* [RSS Feeds](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Notifications#HRSSFeeds)
* [Mentions](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Notifications#HMentions)
* [What's New](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Notifications#HWhat27sNew)

# Notifications Application

XWiki 9.3+ You can receive [notifications](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/) in the top bar, under the Alert entry (represented by a bell).

[![notif2.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notif2.png?width=650&rev=1.5)](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notif2.png?rev=1.5)



# Share Page by mail

The [Share Page Application](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Share%20Page%20Application) allows sending a page by mail to someone (another user of the wiki or any email address).

![sharePageDialog.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Share%20Page%20Application/sharePageDialog.png?rev=1.1)

# RSS Feeds

You can also get notification from activity taking place on an XWiki instance [using RSS feeds](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/RSS).

# Mentions

XWiki 12.5+ You can get notified when somebody mentions you in pages, comments, or fields supporting xwiki syntax, see [Mentions Application](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Mentions%20Application/).

| [notifications](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Notifications/Code/Macro/NotificationsMacro) | Notifications | Notifications | Display notifications about events happened on the wiki. | Current Wiki |
| [notificationsApplicationsPreferences](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Notifications/Code/NotificationsApplicationsPreferencesMacro) | Notifications Applications Preferences | Notifications | Display the preferences of the current user about notification applications. | Current Wiki |
| [notificationsAutoWatchPreferences](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Notifications/Code/NotificationsAutoWatchPreferencesMacro) | Notifications Auto Watch Preferences | Notifications | Display the preferences of the current user about auto watched pages. | Current Wiki |
| [notificationsCustomFiltersPreferences](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Notifications/Code/NotificationsCustomFiltersPreferencesMacro) | Notifications Custom Filters Preferences | Notifications | Display the preferences of the given user about custom notification filters. | Current Wiki |
| [notificationsEmailPreferences](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Notifications/Code/NotificationsEmailPreferencesMacro) | Notifications Email Preferences | Notifications | Display the preferences of the current user about notification emails. | Current Wiki |
| [notificationsFiltersPreferences](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Notifications/Code/NotificationsFiltersPreferencesMacro) | Notifications Filters Preferences (deprecated) | Notifications | Display the preferences of the current user about notification filters.This macro is now deprecated in favor of Custom Notifications Filters Preferences or System Notifications Filters Preferences. | Current Wiki |

* [Description](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HDescription)

	+ [Get a notification RSS feed](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HGetanotificationRSSfeed)

* [Settings](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HSettings)

# Description

This application contributes content in the Alert menu (contributed by the [Alerts Application](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Alerts%20Application/)) in the top bar, represented by a bell:

![Notifications.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/Notifications.png?rev=1.4)

You can find under this menu the notifications about some events happening on the wiki (a page has been modified, a new blog post has been posted, etc...).

The number of notifications is displayed on the top menu, just above the bell:

![notif1.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notif1.png?rev=1.5)

If you have more than 20 unread notifications, you will not see the real count but this instead:

![MaxCounter.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/MaxCounter.png?rev=1.3)

When you open the menu, the content of the notifications is loaded:

![NotificationsLoading.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/NotificationsLoading.png?rev=1.3)

Then you can see the list of notifications:

[![notif2.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notif2.png?rev=1.5)](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notif2.png?rev=1.5)![NotificationsMacro.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/NotificationsMacro.png?rev=1.3)

If you click on the little button with the "check" icon, you mark the notification as "read". In the future, you will be able to select either you want to see only unread notifications or all of them.

When the notification is read, the button disappear and the background color changes:

+ [Choosing the default frequency of notification emails](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HChoosingthedefaultfrequencyofnotificationemails)
	+ [Choosing the default level of details about the changes in the email](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HChoosingthedefaultlevelofdetailsaboutthechangesintheemail)
	+ [Choosing the default auto-watched mode](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HChoosingthedefaultauto-watchedmode)
	+ [Customizing the notification email template](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HCustomizingthenotificationemailtemplate)
	+ [Create global notification filters](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HCreateglobalnotificationfilters)
* [Developers](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HDevelopers)
	+ [Send notifications](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HSendnotifications)
	+ [Override default notification templates in wiki pages](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HOverridedefaultnotificationtemplatesinwikipages)
* [Prerequisites & Installation Instructions](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HPrerequisites26InstallationInstructions)
* [Dependencies](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HDependencies)

# Administrators

Administrators can go to Administration > Notifications to configure some settings about the notifications.

![NotificationsAdministration.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/NotificationsAdministration.png?rev=1.5)

Some properties can be overridden by users. The inheritance is "Main Wiki preferences < Current Wiki preferences < User preferences".

XWiki 13.2+ Administrators can also directly change users' notification settings by going to their profile and click on "Notifications" tab in the menu. The UI is the same as what the user is seeing to customize their own notification settings.

## Enabling notifications for all users by default

In the administration, you can select which application and/or event types should be enabled by default for all users. 

## Choosing the default frequency of notification emails

XWiki 14.10+ Administrators can select the default frequency used for sending emails to users about the changes that have happened on the wiki. This frequency is set to *Daily* by default.

## Choosing the default level of details about the changes in the email

Administrators can select the level of details that users receive on the email, about the changes that have happened to the wiki.

## Choosing the default auto-watched mode

Administrators can select what is the default auto watching page behavior.

![AutoWatchModeAdmin.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/AutoWatchModeAdmin.png?rev=1.3)

You can also edit the xwiki.properties file:

#-# [Since 9.11.8]  
#-# [Since 10.6RC1]  
#-# The automatic watch mode used by default. The value can be changed by an administrator in the wiki's administration  
#-# or by any user in their own settings.  
#-#  
#-# Possible values:  
#-#  
#-# - none:  no page is added to the list of watched pages automatically.

## Emails

You can also select some types of notifications that you will receive by email. You can have different choices enabled by email and in the menu. Then, on the very bottom of the page, you can select the interval between 2 emails. For example, if you choose "Daily" (default), you will receive one email every day with the recap of the events that have happened during the day. Of course, if there were no activity in this period of time, no email is sent. 

Live notifications emails can be sent to a user. The wiki administrator can also define a "grace time" for live email notifications ; when an event that triggers a notification is sent, the platform will wait for the duration of this grace time before sending a notification email. If during this interval, a new event of the same kind is sent, the two events will be grouped in the same email. You can get more informations on how to configure this feature [here](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HCustomizeliveemailnotificationsgracetime).

Of course, it works only if the user has properly filled her e-mail address.

You can edit the frequency of your email notifications by using the selector just at the bottom of the notification preferences pane in your profile page :

![notificationPreferencesEmailUI.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notificationPreferencesEmailUI.png?rev=1.4)

The notifications are sorted by pages and dates, and a table of content summarizes all notifications contained in the email:

![NotifEmailTOC.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/NotifEmailTOC.png?rev=1.3)

A breadcrumb is displayed on top of each notification that concern a page:

![NotifEmailBreadcrumb.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/NotifEmailBreadcrumb.png?rev=1.3)
